III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
Section (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
Description
1

(b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is complying with
the terms of the contract required by R 400.12510, continues to
reside in a safe and acceptable environment, and is managing
expenditures.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth not attending school.
Investigation It was reported Youth A was not attending school and cooperating
with his independent living agreement requirements.
The complainant was interviewed on4/26/23. No additional
information was provided.
I interviewed Administrator 2 by telephone on 04/26/2023.
Administrator 2 stated Youth A had moved within the last two
weeks and that is a contributing factor regarding Youth A's
educational participation. Administrator 2 stated Foster Care
Worker 1 is currently working with Youth A and Foster Care
Worker 1 could provide current information regarding the status of
Youth A.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 by telephone on 06/15/2023.
Foster Care Worker 1 confirmed she is currently working with
Youth A to establish an educational program and other services to
appropriately meet the current needs of Youth A. Foster Care
Worker 1 stated Youth A was not doing well in an adult education
program. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth A relocated to the
Adrian area, but it was too late in the school year for Youth A to be
allowed to enroll in Adrian High School. Summer school and other
alternative education programs were also not available for Youth
A. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth A was court ordered to
attend school but is unable to at the present time until the
educational program can be determined in which Youth A can
enroll and participate. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth A has
been active in completing applications and seeking employment.
Foster Care Worker 1 described Youth A as cooperating with his
independent living agreement. Foster Care Worker 1 stated
Youth A is currently placed with a long-time support person/family
and they are in the process of changing the status of Youth A from
independent living to placement with a relative as the family Youth
A is with meets the standard of the new definition for family.
Analysis The findings of this investigation indicate Youth A has unique
personal, social and educational needs that are assessed and
2

monitored by the agency. Foster Care Worker 1 is working
cooperatively with Youth A in attempts to establish the appropriate
services to meet the needs of Youth A. Youth A is reported to not
currently participate in school. Youth A's lack of participation is
due to circumstances outside the control of Youth A. Foster Care
Worker 1 described Youth A as cooperating with his independent
living agreement, and they are in the process of changing the
status of Youth A from independent living to placement with a
relative. This is possible due to the relative definition as
determined in policy 722-03 B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend the current license status of this child placing agency be maintained.
6/26/2023
